author: @DashaKline
text:
Completely agree with all the points made, but can we also talk about how terrible Adams' term has been for the live preformance scene? 
Back in 2021 and even before the pandemic, my high school friends and I often went to beautiful Prospect park and E. Village garden concerts that were usually student-run with limited equipment and budget. 
The second Adams gets into office, boom! We get cops coming five minutes into every concert asking for  permit, harassing concert goers and demanding that we leave, even though the concerts were nowhere near cause for a noise complaint. One of my best friends was the head of the program setting up these concerts, XR Youth. The concerts were usually raising money for a good cause such as getting innocent men off death row.
 The amount of times I've seen her have panic attacks about cops pressuring her to procure a permit is insane! We were alll 15 at the time as well, just trying to set up some community engagement. The XR Youth New York chapter also shut down shortly after this, (for other reasons as well) but because of how difficult it became to organize any kind of public event, it became really difficult to see any real change. Eric Adams completely killed the punk scene in NYC!!

author: @HighAsHeckPriestess
text:
I was homeless in NYC when i was a teen. The same bastards complaining about homeless folks being unsanitary are the same ones who require purchase to use the restroom and lock up park bathrooms at night. Do they think homeless people just have magic showers? Do they think homeless people wanna be dirty? I had to no call no show to jobs i really liked that paid well here in Colorado because i had nowhere to bathe and i had no tampons. If people care about the sanitary conditions, HOUSING FIRST IS A MUST

Boulder, Colorado is working out of NYC's playbook. I got a ticket in a blizzard when the temperature that night (3am) was -14¬∞F. They had giant German shepherds, and i dont need to explain why that would be terrifying to a black woman. Late at night, theyd blare "LEAVE BOULDER" on the loud speaker on the cruiser. Using offical vehicles to terrorize us. They wrapped the farmers market's portable toilets in chains to keep us from using them.

author: @dezertease
text:
I am Black, I was going to vote for him because he was Brooklyn borough Pres. and I live in Brooklyn.  I had met with him a few times at Brooklyn functions/ events.  We had talked a few times and he even gave me a number (which I never called, so I don't know who would have answered) so if I needed more information about his book I could call.  

I have ulcerative colitis and I think he had something similar and he was telling me about changing my diet.  

So, simply because of those things, I was going to vote for him.  But someone called me to tell me that the mayoral debate was airing live, so I watched it.  Needless to say, I did NOT vote for him, I took my chance with the other guy.  I voted for the other guy, if you watched the debate, you have saw exactly who Adams was going to represent if he got into office... and I thought, it was going to be me.
